question: The predominant stage of the life cycle of a moss is the __________.
The gametophyte of moss consists of __________ stages.
The first stage of the moss gametophyte is the __________ stage.
The protonema stage develops directly from a __________.
The protonema stage is a creeping, green, branched and frequently __________ stage.
The second stage of the moss gametophyte is the __________ stage.
The leafy stage develops from the secondary protonema as a __________.
The leafy stage consists of upright, slender axes bearing __________ arranged leaves.
Mosses are attached to the soil through multicellular and branched __________.
The leafy stage bears the __________ organs.
Vegetative reproduction in mosses is by fragmentation and __________ in the secondary protonema.
In sexual reproduction, the sex organs __________ and archegonia are produced at the apex of the leafy shoots.
In sexual reproduction, the sex organs antheridia and __________ are produced at the apex of the leafy shoots.
After fertilisation, the zygote develops into a __________.
The sporophyte of moss consists of a foot, __________ and capsule.
The sporophyte in mosses is more elaborate than that in __________.
The capsule of moss contains __________.
Spores in moss are formed after __________.
Mosses have an elaborate mechanism of spore __________.
Common examples of mosses are Funaria, Polytrichum and __________.
The protonema stage of moss is green, branched and frequently __________.
The leafy stage develops from the secondary __________.
Rhizoids of moss are multicellular and __________.
In mosses, vegetative reproduction occurs in the __________ protonema.
In mosses, sexual reproduction occurs at the apex of the __________ shoots.
The sporophyte consists of a foot, seta and __________.
The zygote develops into a __________ in mosses.
The capsule contains spores formed after __________.
Mosses show an elaborate mechanism of spore __________.
Funaria, Polytrichum and Sphagnum are common __________ of mosses.
The protonema stage develops directly from a moss __________.
The leafy stage bears the __________ organs.
Moss gametophyte has protonema and __________ stages.
The leafy stage arises from a lateral bud on the secondary __________.
The protonema stage is __________, green, branched and frequently filamentous.
The leafy stage has upright, slender axes with __________ arranged leaves.
The sporophyte in mosses is more elaborate than that in __________.
